intro: Maniltoa vestita, commonly known as the white-flowered maniltoa, is a rare and endemic plant species found primarily in the mountainous regions of the Philippines. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruits are small, drupes that mature to a reddish color, and the plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Maniltoa vestita is considered a vulnerable species.
